Living Skeleton

Undead
Threat Level: Medium

Rare undead beings who have returned from death while retaining their consciousness, personality, and magical abilities. Most are former sorcerers who died violently.

Physical Characteristics

  • Animated skeleton with no flesh or organs
  • Bones held together by magical energy
  • Can appear human with magical facade
  • No need for food, water, or sleep
  • Immune to most physical ailments

Abilities & Powers

  • Retain all pre-death magical abilities
  • Immunity to pain and fatigue
  • Enhanced durability and resilience
  • Can detach and reattach body parts
  • Resistance to death magic

Culture & Society

Living skeletons are extremely rare and often viewed with suspicion even by other magical beings. They typically maintain their previous identities and continue their pre-death occupations. Most struggle with the psychological impact of their undead state.

Weaknesses

  • Bones can be separated or damaged
  • Vulnerable to certain holy artifacts
  • May lose cohesion if magic is disrupted
  • Cannot heal naturally - requires magic
  • Social isolation due to undead nature

Notable Examples

Skulduggery Pleasant Lord Vile (alternate identity)

Vampire

Pure Magical
Threat Level: High

Ancient magical beings with superhuman abilities and an insatiable thirst for blood. They exist in a parallel society with complex hierarchies and territorial disputes.

Physical Characteristics

  • Appear human but with enhanced features
  • Pale skin and pronounced canine teeth
  • Eyes may glow red when feeding or angry
  • Immortal with regenerative abilities
  • Cast no reflection in mirrors

Abilities & Powers

  • Superhuman strength, speed, and agility
  • Enhanced senses and night vision
  • Rapid healing from most injuries
  • Immortality through blood consumption
  • Mesmerism and mental influence

Culture & Society

Vampires organize into ancient families and territories, each with their own Prince or Princess. They maintain elaborate courts and follow strict codes of conduct. Most view humans as food sources and consider themselves superior to other magical beings.

Weaknesses

  • Vulnerable to sunlight (severe burns)
  • Must consume blood regularly
  • Repelled by holy symbols and running water
  • Can be killed by wooden stakes through heart
  • Invitation required to enter homes

Notable Examples

Dusk Vampire Princes Moloch

Zombie

Undead
Threat Level: High

Reanimated corpses driven by an insatiable hunger for living flesh. Unlike other undead, zombies retain no trace of their former personality or intelligence.

Physical Characteristics

  • Decaying human corpses in various stages
  • Clouded, lifeless eyes
  • Shambling, unsteady movement
  • Strong odor of decay
  • Visible wounds and decomposition

Abilities & Powers

  • Immunity to pain and fear
  • Incredible resilience to damage
  • Infectious bite spreads zombie plague
  • Can continue functioning with severe injuries
  • Pack hunting instincts

Behavior & Ecology

Zombies possess no culture or society. They are driven purely by hunger for living flesh and will pursue prey relentlessly. They tend to gather in hordes and can overwhelm even skilled sorcerers through sheer numbers.

Weaknesses

  • Destruction of the brain kills instantly
  • Fire causes significant damage
  • Slow and predictable movement
  • No intelligence or tactical thinking
  • Cannot use tools or magic

Notable Outbreaks

Necromancer Experiments Plague Incidents Containment Breaches
üë§

Remnant

Rare
Threat Level: Extreme

Malevolent entities from another dimension that possess living beings, corrupting them and granting dark powers while maintaining their host's personality and memories.

Physical Characteristics

  • Invisible in their natural form
  • Appear as shadows or darkness
  • Hosts show black veins under skin
  • Eyes may turn completely black
  • Can phase between dimensions

Abilities & Powers

  • Possession of living beings
  • Enhanced host abilities and magic
  • Dimensional travel and phasing
  • Corruption of host's moral compass
  • Near-immortality while possessing

Nature & Behavior

Remnants are parasitic entities that seek powerful hosts to corrupt. They retain their host's personality while gradually eroding their moral constraints. They often work to spread chaos and evil while appearing to be their former selves.

Weaknesses

  • Can be exorcised by powerful magic
  • Vulnerable when between hosts
  • Certain holy artifacts repel them
  • Host's strong will can resist possession
  • Killing host may destroy remnant

Known Incidents

Tanith Low (possessed) Mass Possession Events Dimensional Breaches
üåå

Faceless One

Pure Magical
Threat Level: Godlike

Ancient gods who once ruled multiple dimensions. Banished by the first sorcerers, they seek to return and reclaim their dominion over all existence.

Physical Characteristics

  • Massive humanoid forms
  • Completely smooth faces with no features
  • Dark, imposing presence
  • Size varies from human to building height
  • Body composition appears non-human

Abilities & Powers

  • Reality manipulation on massive scales
  • Dimensional travel and control
  • Immunity to most forms of damage
  • Command over multiple magical disciplines
  • Ability to grant power to followers

History & Influence

The Faceless Ones were the original rulers of this dimension, worshipped as gods by early humans. Their tyrannical rule led to the first magical rebellion. Though banished, they still influence our world through cults and artifacts.

Weaknesses

  • Cannot fully enter this dimension without invitation
  • Vulnerable to God-Killer weapons
  • Banishment seals limit their power
  • Require massive energy to manifest
  • Can be contained by ancient rituals

Known Manifestations

Aranmore Incident Portal Breaches Diablerie Summonings

Hollow Men

Magical
Threat Level: Medium

Magical constructs created to serve as guardians and enforcers. They possess no true consciousness but are highly effective at following orders and protecting locations.

Physical Characteristics

  • Humanoid shape made of various materials
  • Paper, wood, or cloth construction common
  • Featureless or crudely drawn faces
  • Move with jerky, unnatural motions
  • Size varies based on creator's intent

Abilities & Powers

  • Follow programmed commands perfectly
  • Enhanced strength for their materials
  • Can be repaired if damaged
  • Immune to pain and fear
  • Some varieties have special abilities

Creation & Purpose

Hollow Men are created by skilled sorcerers to serve specific purposes. They're commonly used as guards, servants, or foot soldiers. Their effectiveness depends entirely on their creator's skill and the materials used.

Weaknesses

  • Limited intelligence and adaptability
  • Vulnerable to their construction materials
  • Can be destroyed by disrupting their magic
  • Cannot act beyond their programming
  • Creator's death may disable them

Common Types

Paper Sentries Wooden Guards Cloth Servants

White Cleaver

Undead
Threat Level: Extreme

Extremely rare and dangerous undead warriors created through necromantic rituals. They serve as the ultimate enforcers with unwavering loyalty and devastating combat abilities.

Physical Characteristics

  • Tall, imposing humanoid figures
  • Completely covered in white clothing
  • Face hidden behind white mask or hood
  • Moves with fluid, predatory grace
  • Carries ornate scythe or blade

Abilities & Powers

  • Master-level combat skills
  • Supernatural speed and agility
  • Near-immunity to physical damage
  • Necromantic powers and death magic
  • Absolute loyalty to their creator

Creation & Purpose

White Cleavers are created through forbidden necromantic rituals that bind a powerful soul to serve eternally. They are typically made from the most skilled warriors or sorcerers, enhanced by death magic to become perfect killers.

Weaknesses

  • Bound to their creator's will
  • Vulnerable to certain holy artifacts
  • Can be disrupted by powerful necromancy
  • May retain fragments of original personality
  • Creation ritual can be reversed

Known White Cleavers

Unnamed White Cleaver Necromancer Servants Ancient Warriors

The Ancients

Pure Magical
Threat Level: Legendary

The first magical beings who originally banished the Faceless Ones. Most have transcended physical form, but their influence and artifacts still shape the magical world.

Physical Characteristics

  • Most exist beyond physical form
  • When manifest, appear as idealized humans
  • Radiate visible magical energy
  • Age varies from ancient to timeless
  • May appear as pure light or energy

Abilities & Powers

  • Mastery over multiple magical disciplines
  • Reality manipulation capabilities
  • Creation of powerful magical artifacts
  • Dimensional travel and perception
  • Near-immortality and transcendence

Legacy & Influence

The Ancients established the foundations of modern magic and created many of the most powerful artifacts. Most have moved beyond physical existence, but they occasionally intervene in mortal affairs during times of great crisis.

Limitations

  • Limited interaction with physical world
  • Bound by cosmic laws and balances
  • Cannot directly interfere too often
  • Some may have transcended beyond caring
  • Artifacts can be destroyed or corrupted
